itemLabel: Charles Hill, Baron Hill of Luton

wikipedia_page.main: Charles Hill, Baron Hill of Luton, PC (15 January 1904 – 22 August 1989) was a British physician and medical spokesman, radio speaker, member of parliament, government minister and broadcasting executive.

response: *Charles Hill, Baron Hill of Luton, Chairman of the BBC and ITA

link_mentions.page: Barts and The London School of Medicine and Dentistry
response: * Charles Hill, Baron Hill of Luton – Politician and former chairman of the BBC

* Charles Hill, Baron Hill of Luton (1904-1989), National Liberal and Conservative MP for Luton from 1950–63, Postmaster General from 1953–7, and Chairman from 1967–77 of the Board of Governors of the BBC
* Charles Hill, Baron Hill of Luton (1904–1989), English administrator, doctor and television executive
#REDIRECT Charles Hill, Baron Hill of Luton

Charles Hill, Baron Hill of Luton before his life peerage served as a National Liberal and Conservative until 1963 when he died. His party had been re-created again in coalition with the Conservatives in 1931.   The two largest parties won the seat from 1963 until 1974.
#REDIRECT Charles Hill, Baron Hill of Luton
